summary: Decide editor strategy for long-form writing and future auto-correction
problem_statement: The platform currently uses a native textarea-based Markdown editor while future plans assume editor-level capabilities such as safe auto-correction and transaction-aware undo. Without an explicit editor strategy decision, subsequent work risks architectural misalignment, wasted effort, and trust-breaking UX regressions for long-form writers.
in_scope: Evaluate current textarea-based Markdown editor against long-term product goals
Assess feasibility and implications of migrating to TipTap/ProseMirror
Compare UX, performance, accessibility, and complexity trade-offs
Decide and document the chosen editor direction
requirements: At least two viable editor strategies are clearly articulated
Trade-offs are evaluated against long-form writer UX goals
A single editor direction is explicitly selected and justified
acceptance_criteria: A written decision document exists and is linked from the issue
The decision is explicit, unambiguous, and future-facing
No production code behavior has changed
dependencies: Clarity on long-term writing and UX goals
risks: Deferring the decision leads to mis-scoped implementation work
Choosing an editor that undermines writer trust or flow
implementation_notes: This issue is a strategy and positioning decision only. Bias toward clarity and commitment over optionality. The output should constrain future work, not keep options open indefinitely.
